generalInfo:
Explore the Pearl of the Indian Ocean on this week-long tour of Sri Lanka that packs in all of the highlights. Discover the island's spiritual history, wandering through ancient cities and intricate temples before spotting wildlife on safari in Wilpattu National Park. Take in the views from two of Sri Lanka's famous peaks, before unwinding on white-sand, tropical beaches.

Wilpattu National Park - Take a jeep safari to search for leopards, elephants, and sambar deer.
Sigiriya - Climb the UNESCO Heritage Site of Lion Rock and soak up stunning views of the surrounding plains.
Dambulla - Explore the incredible painted cave temple filled with Buddha statues and share a meal with a local family.

dayInfo.title: Join trip in Negombo
dayInfo.description: : Our tour starts today in Negombo, a coastal town that's famous for its fishing industry and golden sands. The perfect introduction to Sri Lankan life, Negombo is a busy coastal town with a lively fish market, and traditional ketti-maran (catamaran) fishing boats scudding across the waters - the capital, Colombo, is a short distance away, too. Head down to the water to catch the sunset and spot locals bringing in the day's catch. For those arriving in time, our tour leader plans to meet you in the hotel reception at 6pm for a welcome meeting and for those that wish, there is the chance to go out for dinner. There are no other activities planned today, so you're free to arrive in Negombo at any time. If you'd like an airport transfer, you'll need to arrive into Colombo's Bandaranaike International Airport (CMB), which is a 30-minute drive from our hotel. If you miss the welcome meeting, your tour leader will inform you of any essential information as soon as you catch up. If your flight arrives earlier in the day, you might like to head to the beach or make use of the hotel facilities which include a swimming pool.

dayInfo.title: Game drive in Wilpattu National Park; drive to Anuradhapura
dayInfo.description: : Leaving Negombo this morning, we'll travel north following the coastal road via the small towns of Chilaw and Putalam before reaching the entrance to Wilpattu National Park, a drive of around four hours including stops. Here, we'll leave our bus and hop in jeeps for an afternoon safari through the park, hoping to spot Sri Lanka's most elusive resident, the leopard. Despite its location in Sri Lanka's dry zone, Wilpattu National Park boasts nearly 60 lakes and is renowned for being home to leopards, elephants and sambar deer. We'll head out on a jeep safari in the hope of spotting the elusive leopard. We choose to visit this park, rather than the more touristy Yala National Park further south because we believe it offers our customers a better experience. The same animals can be seen here as in Yala, however, it's less crowded, making our visit more enjoyable and responsible. Leaving the park, we'll drive onwards for about one hour to nearby Anuradhapura, where we'll spend the night.

dayInfo.title: Walk up Mihintale Mount, explore Dambulla cave temples, drive to Sigiriya
dayInfo.description: : We start early this morning with a visit to Mihintale - a small mountain peak that stands out from the surrounding plains. It's believed that this was the site of a momentous meeting between the monk Mahinda and King Devanampiyatissa, introducing Buddhism to the country. Exploring Mihintale involves climbing a flight of shallow stone steps, and a short final section with uneven steps carved into the bedrock and a handrail leading to the summit. There are excellent panoramic views from the top across the entire surrounding landscape. Afterwards, we'll drive south stopping enroute for a local lunch experience. Travelling like locals, we'll reach Hiriwaduna village by tractor-drawn cart and dugout canoe-style boats crossing the short distance across the lake to the village, where we'll be treated to a traditional Sri Lankan lunch of various curries and rice. Our next stop is Dambulla, where a series of caves have been turned into temples dating from the 1st century BC. This UNESCO World Heritage Site still attracts scores of worshippers. After climbing the hill we'll visit five separate caves, which contain a large number of Buddha images, as well as sculptures of Hindu Gods. Finally, we'll drive the short distance to Sigiriya where we'll spend the night.

dayInfo.title: Climb Lion Rock at sunrise, drive to Kandy
dayInfo.description: : We'll have an early start this morning as we plan to climb Sigiriya ahead of the crowds and while it's still relatively cool. Rising dramatically from the central plains, the UNESCO-protected ruins of this 5th-century 'Sky Fortress' are one of Sri Lanka's major attractions and an impressive feat of engineering skill. The fortress was built in just seven years as a fortified palace atop the granite peak, to protect the reign of merciless King Kassapa who had assassinated his father and deposed his brother. Before our final ascent to the summit, we'll pass between a set of enormous lion paws carved out of the rock - all that remains of an ancient gateway that gave Sigiriya, the 'Lion Rock', its name. From here a series of switchback steel stairways ascend to the top. Once at the 200-metre/656-foot summit, we can take in the magnificent views of the surrounding jungle and countryside. We return to our hotel in time for a late breakfast. After a chance to have breakfast and freshen up, we leave the hotel at around 11am and we'll drive for around two and a half hours to Kandy. Sitting on a plateau 500 metres/1640 feet above sea level and 112 kilometres/69 miles northeast of Colombo, Kandy is, in climatic and cultural terms, a world apart from Colombo. Serving as the capital of the last Sinhalese kingdom until falling to the British in 1815, it's a place of cultural and spiritual importance. Buddhists from all over the world come here specifically to visit the Temple of the Tooth, the Dalada Maligawa. The costly jewelled shrine of the Holy Tooth, said to be Buddha's left canine, is kept on the upper floor of the original building. This relic was brought from India 1,500 years ago and every year, at the time of the August full moon, it is paraded around the town as part of the Perahera Festival. On arrival, we'll have free time to explore this historic town. You might like to visit the Temple of the Tooth or take a short tuk-tuk ride out to Peradeniya Botanical Gardens.

dayInfo.title: Visit highlands tea producer, drive to Koggala beach via Galle Fort
dayInfo.description: : Leaving Kandy behind us today, we'll stop at a tea factory to learn about Sri Lanka's largest export. In 1842, a tea bush was brought from China to be planted at Peradeniya Botanical Gardens and 25 years later, James Taylor established Sri Lanka's first tea plantation - the Loolecondera Estate in Kandy. These days, more than one million people in Sri Lanka are employed in the tea industry. The tea factory we'll visit is a small and intimate one so we won't see the tea leaves being picked but we will witness the process of drying and grinding the leaves. We'll also get to sample some of the blends before leaving tea country. After our visit, we'll drive for another four hours to the southwest coast and pay a visit to Galle Fort. An important trading centre since ancient times, the fortifications that can be seen today were built by the Portuguese and then the Dutch between the 16th and 17th centuries. The fort ramparts of this UNESCO World Heritage Site protect the harbour and a myriad of fascinating old houses, churches and warehouses. Finally, we'll follow the coast east to our base for our final two nights in Koggala. With its shallow waters and long, pristine beaches, it's the perfect place to unwind.

dayInfo.title: Free time to explore Galle, whale watching (seasonal) or time to relax at Koggala Beach
dayInfo.description: : Today you're free to do as little or as much as you wish. A half hour taxi ride will take you back to the pretty coastal town of Galle. Today, the town has a strong arts vibe, with foreign and local artists, writers, photographers, designers, and poets drawing inspiration from their surroundings. Boutique shops and cafes around the town showcase their work. There's plenty to explore in the town and you can soak up the atmosphere with a wander around its streets. For those seeking pure relaxation, local Ayurvedic massages with natural, aromatic herbal oils are highly recommended. Alternatively, between the months of December and April, you might prefer to go on a whale-watching trip in the hope of spotting humpback and blue whales.

dayInfo.title: Fly to the Maldives and join trip in Male
dayInfo.description: : This morning, we'll fly to Male and after meeting up with our representative we'll transfer to our hotel. After checking in, we'll go on a walking tour of the town, taking in the Mosque, the fish market and strolling along the water's edge to watch the ferries coming and going. Please note, not all group members will join the Maldives extension trip and we'll be saying goodbye to some in Colombo.

dayInfo.title: Sail to Vavuu Atoll and explore Kuda Boli
dayInfo.description: : This morning, we'll drive to Hulhumale Marina to meet our moored dhoni and crew. We'll have breakfast onboard and our tour leader will take time to introduce the crew and tell us about the boat and our day-to-day living for the coming days. We then begin a four-hour cruise south, passing through the Vaadhoo Canal to the South Male Atoll - a smaller and quieter neighbour to the more developed North Male Atoll. Here, many of the islands are uninhabited and are surrounded by clear turquoise water and reefs. Heading further south, we'll cruise to the Vavuu Atoll, where we'll spend time exploring the picturesque island of Kudiboli. Please note, you don't need special footwear for getting on and off the boat and exploring these islands - most travellers manage just fine in flip-flops. After our island exploration, we'll spend the afternoon snorkelling or relaxing onboard our dhoni. For our first snorkel we plan to enter the sea from the beach or sand bar into relatively calm waters. All subsequent snorkelling and swimming will be directly from the boat, over reefs and into deeper waters. Over the week, we're likely to encounter plenty of underwater fauna. We might be lucky enough to spot green turtles, reef sharks and gigantic manta rays, as well as smaller sting rays and eagle rays. At each stop, we'll also swim amongst a rainbow of small, colourful fish, including the famous Clown Fish. Our knowledgeable local guides will be able to help identify many of the underwater species that we come across. All meals are included on the dhoni. Menus are likely to include freshly caught fish, as well as curries and pasta. Drinking water, tea and coffee are readily available, with alcoholic and soft drinks can be purchased on-board, too. You can pay your bill for drinks at the end of your cruise in USD or by credit card. Cabins are compact but spacious enough for two people. You also have the option to sleep on deck under the stars some nights. Please note that the itinerary is entirely dependent on the local weather, winds and tides. It's very often necessary to adapt the planned itinerary to local conditions.

dayInfo.title: Snorkel in the clear waters of the Vaavu Atoll
dayInfo.description: : Today (if weather conditions for the next couple of days allow it) we'll sail south for a further two or three hours, crossing to Meemu Atoll. If the weather stops us from doing that, we'll continue to explore Vaavu Atoll, snorkelling in the turtle reef before cruising on to Loabi Faru to snorkel in the pristine reef there. Back on the dhoni, we'll cruise over to Bongo Veli where we plan to spend the night close to a popular sandbank known for its pristine white sand. We'll have time in the late afternoon to enjoy the white-sand beach, swim and watch the sunset. Later this evening, we can look forward to a barbeque beach banquet in an idyllic spot on the island, laid on by the dhoni crew.

dayInfo.title: Cruise to Felidhoo Island
dayInfo.description: : After breakfast., we cruise for about an hour to Ruhhuri Hura for a snorkel in a quieter reef. We travel on a short distance to Acho Kacho Reef nearby for another chance to marvel at the marine life and have a swim and snorkel. Cruising north, we reach the Felidhoo, the administrative centre of Felidhoo Atoll. With a population of about 400, this is the least populated of all the country's administrative centres. Again, we'll take it easy, taking time to visit the village, meet the island's inhabitants and learn about their traditional, yet relaxed, way of life. Please note, not many tourist groups visit the village and it's essential to dress and act respectfully. This includes removing shoes when visiting a house or a mosque.

dayInfo.title: Shipwreck snorkel. Visit the traditional village of Fulidhoo. Bodu Beru drum display
dayInfo.description: : Now we've gotten into the flow of island living, our daily routine likely includes reading, sunbathing and napping between island exploration and snorkelling. Our first dip in the ocean today is to snorkel over a shipwreck, spotting myriad colourful fish. In the afternoon, we'll pick another suitably sheltered location for our second snorkel of the day. With a subtly different name to our previous day's stop-off, we plan to spend tonight at anchor off Fulidhoo Island. Once again, we'll meet the locals and gain more of an appreciation for their life in this tropical paradise. This evening, we'll enjoy a Bodu Beru performance, the traditional folk music of the country. Please note that during the month of Ramadan it's not possible to arrange the Bodu Beru drumming performance. In 2026 this runs from 17th February to 18th March, and in 2027 from 7th February to 8th March.

dayInfo.title: Nurse shark reef snorkel before sailing to South Malee Atoll
dayInfo.description: : For an early morning snorkel today, we'll dip into the waters at Nurse Shark Reef. We'll then start to motor back north for around three hours, crossing the channel once again to South Malee Atoll with time for another snorkel at a sheltered spot.

dayInfo.title: Sail to Male stopping to snorkel at Maafushi Coral Garden and Stingray Point
dayInfo.description: : Our last day on the boat sees us cruising back towards Male. Of course, we'll take the opportunity for a final splash in the water with a spot of snorkelling and swimming, at Maafushi Coral Garden and Stingray Point, before enjoying a farewell meal with our boat crew. If the weather is clear, we'll try to find a natural spot to drop anchor for tonight but most often we find ourselves in Gulhi Falhu Marina.

dayInfo.title: Trip ends in Male
dayInfo.description: : The trip ends after breakfast on our dhoni in Male. The crew need to start preparing for the next voyage so we are off boarded after breakfast and dropped at the airport for 9am. There are no activities planned today, however, the earliest your flight can depart is 11am. If your flight is departing later in the day, luggage storage facilities are available at the airport for a cost of $6 per item. If you'd like an airport transfer today, you'll need to depart from Male International Airport (MLE).

generalInfo:
Dive into the history, culture, and joys of the beautiful islands of the Maldives. From fishing villages to ancient Buddhist temples, you'll find something new every day on this unique tour. Explore the beautiful forests and mangroves of the Maldives. Join us as we walk in the jungle, take a canoe ride on the lagoon and spend an evening stargazing. With opportunities to relax on quiet white sandy beaches, snorkel tropical waters and enjoy uninterrupted views of Maldivian sunsets this is a Maldives island hopping experience not to be missed.

Designed and led by local travel experts, this is a truly innovative travel experience.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to the Maldives Upon arrival at Male Velana International Airport, you will be met by your tour guide who will be there to assist with boarding your domestic flight to Hanimaadhoo. The flight time is just under an hour and gives you amazing views of this picture-perfect archipelago. From Hanimaadhoo it is a 30 minute speedboat journey across the ocean to Kelaa where you will have time to settle in and freshen up before dinner. Kelaa is a unique island situated in the Haa Alif atoll and is home to a population of over 1600 people. The local community inhabit less than one third of the island, while the rest is forest. You can find powder fine white sandy beach on one side of the island and a rocky coral shore on the other. It also has one of the largest lagoons in Maldives at approximately 6km in length. After dinner your guide will give a presentation into waste management in the Maldives and the work that is being done in the war against plastic. Overnight - Deluxe Room, Beach Home Kelaa (D)

Local Village Experience Explore the village on a walking tour this morning. Discover a mosque built during the reign of Sultan Mohamed Ibn Ali (Muhammad Mohyeddine) (AD 1692-1701) of the Utheemu Dynasty, the king who re-established the Islamic penal code. There is time to freshen up after the walk before we join a local lady at the café for a cookery demonstration. You will be shown how to make mashuni and roshi, a very typical Maldivian dish which you will then enjoy for your lunch. Post lunch, there is time to relax in the comfort of the guesthouse. You can take a stroll along the beach, sit in the shade of a palm tree or snorkel in the crystal clear water. Later, we will take a walk with a member of IDEAs NGO. Island Development and Environmental Awareness Society (IDEAS) is a non-governmental youth organization based in the northern tip of the Maldives. Founded in 2002, IDEAS mission is to promote socio-economic development of youth, women, differently abled and the community, as well as to promote sustainable development in the Maldives islands. We will be introduced to the mangroves that run along the rocky beach of Kelaa, which is one of the biggest small leafed orange mangrove areas in the Maldives. Learn about the interesting history of ‘kandoo’ as a food source and why it gained particular importance during the Second World War. This evening you will have a presentation by your guide on the importance of seagrass in the Maldives and why locals are campaigning to protect it. Overnight - Deluxe Room, Beach Home Kelaa (BD)

Coral Reefs and Marine Life We start today with a presentation by your guide on Maldives Coral Reefs and Marine Life. Following this we will take a speedboat to some of the nearby reefs in search of turtles, reef sharks and other tropical marine life. Once we have had the important safety briefing on responsible snorkelling, you can put on your fins, mask, and snorkel (all provided) and jump into the warm, azure waters of the Indian Ocean. Your snorkelling guide will act as your spotter, pointing out marine life that may not have caught your eye. If you are less confident or inexperienced, do not worry as your guide is also there to assist and to ensure your equipment is comfortable and you feel safe in the water. We will spend some time on the beach supporting a beach clean and giving back to the community that has welcomed us. Our reward will be the traditional afternoon treat known as hedikaa. This is black tea served with small savoury and sweet bites. Discover delicacies such as Gulha, bite-sized balls of tuna, onions and grated coconut wrapped in thin flatbread-type dough and paan boakibaa, which is bread cake stuffed with dates and nuts. Overnight - Deluxe Room, Beach Home Kelaa (BD)

Relaxing and Reefs After we have our breakfast, we will take a speedboat journey back to Hanimaadhoo and check-in at the Barefoot ECO Hotel. Once here, the rest of the morning is free to relax. There are plenty of water sport activities to participate in or if you are looking for a more chilled day , you can relax on the beach, at the pool or pamper yourself in the spa. In the afternoon we take a boat ride to a nearby reef. We will see abundant marine life such as turtles, reef sharks, sting rays, and a multitude of colourful fish including oriental sweetlips, clown fish and parrotfish. The perfect end to a relaxing day comes as we make our way to a nearby deserted sandbank in time to enjoy the sunset with nothing other than a few seabirds for company. Overnight - Beach Front Room, Barefoot Eco Hotel (BD)

Utheemu Today’s adventures start with a visit to the historical island of Utheemu and we explore the well preserved palace of Ganduvaru and Kandhuvalu Mosque. Utheemu is known as the birthplace of Sultan Mohamed Thakurufaanu, who with his brothers and his companions fought an eight-year-long war to drive out the Portuguese invaders who occupied the Maldives from 1558 to 1573. Utheemu Ganduvaru is the wooden palace in which Sultan Mohamed Thakurufaanu lived and grew up. It is well preserved and evokes more than any other existing building in the Maldives, the lifestyle of the rich, centuries ago. It's a tiny place with a beautiful teak interior that can be glimpsed from the entrance and Thakurufaanu's father is buried in the cemetery here. Later in the afternoon, the gardeners from the Barefoot Eco Hotel will provide a small tour of their vegetable area and garden. There will also be the opportunity to plant a few coconut palms. Overnight - Beach Front Room, Barefoot Eco Hotel (BD)

Sunset Fish BBQ This morning we take a guided tour of Hanimaadhoo Agricultural Centre. Lush with an impressive variety of crops, we will discover local favourites such as watermelon, banana, and papaya, as well as more exotic varieties such as aloe vera and dragon fruit. Dedicated to enriching the local diet and knowledge, the Agricultural Centre also boasts a goat pen and a greenhouse. We will return to Barefoot in time for lunch and then the afternoon is yours to relax. Just before sunset we will be taken out by dhoni to learn the art of traditional Maldivian line fishing. Your catch will then be served to you via the BBQ for dinner. Overnight - Beach Front Room, Barefoot Eco Hotel (BD)
Return to Male We will head back to the airport for the departure flight to Male or your onward transfer to next selected destination. (B)

tourName: Best of Maldives Tour: A Tropical Paradise Getaway
generalInfo: Luxury, pristine beauty, and personalized service await during your 12-day exclusive Maldives vacation. Enjoy night snorkeling in search of glowing marine life, indulge in lunch on an uninhabited island, or bask in a perfect customized spa treatment. From a private island to an opulent cruise, tropical foliage to crystal-clear waters, embrace the best of the Maldives found in the Baa Atoll Biosphere Reserve.

dayInfo.title: Landaa Giraavaru - Arrive in the Maldives
dayInfo.description: The Maldives is a tropical paradise of coral reefs, private lagoons, and colorful marine life that make for a luxurious getaway. The soft and clear waters of the Indian Ocean lap against beaches shining with soft white sands. Your flight will land at Velana International Airport, where you will continue by seaplane to Landaa Giraavaru. The idyllic island rises out of the UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. The stunning iridescent water will shimmer blue against the green jungle canopy and powdery white sands. The remainder of the day lets you settle into the comforts of your resort at your own pace.

dayInfo.title: Landaa Giraavaru - Indulge in Tropical Beauty
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you may find a soothing mixture of aromas, from tropical fruits like coconut to the sea breeze drifting across the beach. The day is yours to bask in the paradisaical charms of the island, from discovering the superb marine life ringing the more than 13 inhabited islands of the atoll to learning more about the traditional lacquer work boxes or woven-cotton sarongs. Discover the waters on your first day with a snorkeling excursion to find the 250 species of coral, and then drift in the warm water and find signs of sea anemones and clownfish.

dayInfo.title: Landaa Giraavaru - Embrace Paradise and Leisure
dayInfo.description: As you explore the island life around Landaa Giraavaru, you can take to the Marine Discovery Centre for more insight into the turtle rehabilitation protecting the vital biosphere. You can experience a unique encounter with nature as you witness the marine creatures in their natural habitat. The warm water and golden sun will accentuate the natural beauty as the local guide offers more information on the Maldivian sea turtles. You can continue exploring the marine life by visiting the Maldivian Manta Ray Project and watching the large manta rays glide through the ocean.

dayInfo.title: Landaa Giraavaru - Explore at your Own Pace
dayInfo.description: Discover the joys of the waters on a sailing excursion around the islands after breakfast. You can set sail and capture the breeze for a stunning panorama of the Indian Ocean and white-sand beaches sprouting out of the Baa Atoll Biosphere Reserve. The small catamaran is a safe way to glide through the calm waters with buoyancy. When you return from your journey along the shorelines, you can settle beneath the shade of an umbrella to relax in the calming sounds of the Indian Ocean lapping against the beach.

dayInfo.title: Landaa Giraavaru - Discover Landaa Giraavaru
dayInfo.description: The day is yours to enjoy and discover the island at your leisure. In the evening, you can embrace the night with an after-dark snorkeling excursion for a unique encounter with marine life. The majestic ambiance will light up the night as you find bioluminescent fish. Beyond the sporadic light beneath the waves, you can find active nocturnal marine life like spotted spiny lobster, octopus, and the blooming tendrils of Orange Cup Coral. You can end your adventurous outing with a private dinner beneath the stars for a celebration of both the sea and sky.

dayInfo.title: Landaa Giraavaru - Find Landaa Giraavaru’s Variety
dayInfo.description: The variety of excursions and experiences at your resort will immerse you in luxuries and relaxation. The day is once more yours to discover the splendor of the Maldives and the wonders of the Baa Atoll Biosphere Reserve. You can kayak along the crystal-clear waters or recharge your body and mind with a yoga class. You could also relax with a personalized wellness experience during an Ayurvedic massage. The Ayurvedic technique highlights the beauty of the herb garden on treats you in an over-water villa for a blissful massage coupled with elegant aromas from herbs, powders, and heated oils.

dayInfo.title: Landaa Giraavaru - Relax in Island Comfort
dayInfo.description: With so many possible excursions, enjoy the variety of options at your preferred pace, from exploring the tropical foliage to catching the breeze with a windsurfing excursion. You can take a relaxing day to rest beneath the sunlight and dig your toes into the powdery white sands along the private beach. Listen to the waves or return to the spa for a retreat within your getaway. You can also learn more about the local culture through the artisan crafts with images of customary jars or discover more about the cotton feyli.

dayInfo.title: Baa Atoll - Embark on your Luxury Scenic Cruise
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will board a yacht for a multi-day cruise around the Baa Atoll UNESCO Biosphere Reserve to discover the waters and shores beyond Landaa Giraavaru and reach the pristine garden island of Kuda Huraa. As the yacht sets sail, you can bask in the quiet ambiance of the breeze and the nearby panorama of turquoise waters stretching to beneath the island treeline. As you sail, the cruise can weigh anchor for a scuba diving expedition where you can dive beneath the water in search of colorful clownfish, active sponges, and sightings of elegant angelfish.

dayInfo.title: Baa Atoll - Enjoy the Baa Atoll Biosphere Reserve
dayInfo.description: Your cruise will continue across the atoll and showcase the marvelous marine diversity as you find evidence of over 1,000 different species of fish finding refuge in the protected seascape. As you dive back into the water for a snorkeling or scuba diving experience, you may find signs of whale sharks in the area. The elusive but enticing whale shark often swims through the channel throughout the year and can give you a majestic yet unexpected delight. Onboard the ship, your captain may call your attention to the distance to spot a pod of dolphins leaping from the water.

dayInfo.title: Baa Atoll - Embrace the Gorgeous Fluidity
dayInfo.description: As you sail along the crystal-clear waters, your captain will offer both the beauty of the seascape and a rare fluidity that allows you to experience the best sailing conditions. You may stop at an octopus refuge along rocky pinnacles that protect the marine life. Soft coral and active invertebrates thrive in the broad channels between the atolls. You could dive into the crystalline depths to view the untouched ecosystem that also attracts schools of rays and looming whitetip sharks. The wild views of the water may contrast the refreshing and serene ambiance onboard the boat.

dayInfo.title: Baa Atoll - Traverse the Sensational Sea
dayInfo.description: Your final, full-day on the cruise gives you plenty of time to enjoy the sights, sea, and air at your preferred pace. You can once more take to the water or enjoy an island excursion for a delicious gourmet lunch on an uninhabited island. You can feel completely secluded as the aromas of a catered food overtake the scent of the sea. You can also visit a remote village for a cultural experience that will teach you more about the local traditions, including the villagers’ connection to rugby. You could relax with one more spa treatment before your cruise ends.

dayInfo.title: Baa Atoll - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: On the island of Kuda Huraa, you can experience a different side of the Maldives. The azure waters remain clear and can blend into the sky at the horizon, but the garden island offers tropical splendor magnified. You may find the scent of breadfruit blending in with the sea breeze as you take to the water for a private surf lesson before you transfer by speedboat to Male to check-in for your flight home.

tourName: Breathtaking 14-Day Beach Vacation in the Maldives and Thailand
placesVisited: Maldives, Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Phuket, Koh Phi Phi
generalInfo: Tropical white sand shores with crystal clear seas are set to seduce you on this 14-day Thailand and the Maldives beach vacation. Embrace the thrill of adventure partaking in exciting watersports, delve into Thai culture on explorations of the capital city and northern Lanna villages, and photograph the immaculate coastal scenery and pearls of the Andaman Sea during this handcrafted getaway that embodies the perfect tropical escape.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Make Memories in the Maldives
dayInfo.description: The Maldives archipelago in South Asia boasts some of the best beaches in the world. The beautiful cyan-blue waters enwreathe powdery white sand shorelines lined with palm trees and chartreuse-colored vegetation. Islands big and small compose the archipelago, and accommodation speckles the idyllic coastlines. Piers jut out into the sea with suites appearing to hang over the shimmering water’s surface. You will enjoy the secluded pleasures of your accommodation in the Maldives after transferring from the airport and tuck into sensational seafood as the sunsets over the oceanic horizon.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Snorkel in the Sun-Kissed Sea
dayInfo.description: The Maldives archipelago is a coastal paradise that provides endless watersport activities and experiences for you to soak up the sunshine and swim in the warm water during your stay. You will take your time exploring the seascapes and tropical islands of the Maldives, absorbing the laidback atmosphere as you partake in a combination of thrilling and relaxing activities. This afternoon will bring with it an opportunity to snorkel amongst the sparkling coral reefs just beyond the shore. You will spot a variety of colorful fish and fascinating marine creatures as you swim around the sun-kissed islands.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Action-Packed Watersport Activities
dayInfo.description: Having had a day to unwind and slowly uncover the splendors of the Maldives, you will wake up eager to experience the more thrilling watersport experiences across the archipelago. Today, you may choose from water flying, tubing, parasailing, and more to embrace the action-packed activities on offer around the Maldives. During a water flying or parasailing tour, you will take to the skies to see new perspectives of the Maldives. Tubing tours will let you race across the water faster than you could imagine. Each experience will make your stay in the Maldives that much more meaningful and memorable.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Sit Back and Relax in Style
dayInfo.description: You will watch the sunrise over the Maldives this morning as the gentle wind rolls off the sea and light pours from the baby blue sky. The wafts of breakfast will entice you to the restaurant, where you will indulge in a selection of continental and local cuisine. Today, you may spend your time relaxing around the pool, swimming in the ocean, or invigorating your mind and body with spa therapies at your accommodation’s wellness center. An afternoon stroll during sunset and dinner on the sand will complete a dreamy day on the stunning islands.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Island Hopping in the Maldives
dayInfo.description: There is nothing quite like a sunrise SUP or paddleboard in the Maldives, an opportunity to drift out over the ocean and capture the scenery as you hover on top of the glistening water. After paddling back to shore, you will settle in for breakfast and begin to map out another day discovering the Maldives’ marvelous islands. You may hop from one islet to the next in search of hideaway beaches, kayak across the crystal clear waters, walk amongst the flourishing forests, and snorkel a series of vibrant coral reefs before you return for dinner and star-gazing this evening.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Thailand’s Bustling Capital City
dayInfo.description: You will wake up to watch the sunrise over the Maldives one last time before grabbing your things, joining your transfer, and heading to the airport to catch your flight to Thailand. Bangkok, the country’s capital, will invite you to let loose and embrace the cityscape’s high-octane energy from the moment you arrive at your accommodation in a bustling district. You will see boats gliding across the Chao Phraya River, temples glimmering under the sunshine, and crowds flooding nearby food markets as you acclimate to Bangkok’s bustling atmosphere this afternoon.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Cultural Tour of Ratchaburi and the Capital
dayInfo.description: An insightful guide will meet you after breakfast to show you around the Land of Smiles, starting in Ratchaburi. Seated comfortably in a longtail boat at the Damnoen Saduak Floating Market, you will snake between wooden homes that float above the water and pick fruits and vegetables from stalls on the ships that you pass by. You will return to Bangkok sipping fresh juice from a coconut, and begin a city tour at the famous Wat Phra Kaew and the Grand Palace. Discovering more sacred temples of Bangkok, you will deeply connect with Thailand’s proud spiritual and cultural beliefs.

dayInfo.title: Bangkok - Masterclass in Thai Cuisine
dayInfo.description: Markets make up a massive part of Bangkok’s culinary culture, and each presents an endless stream of stalls that serve traditional delicacies, modern creations, and fusion dishes. You will smell fragrant spices spilling from wooden bowls, indulge in authentic Pad Thai , a stir-fried rice noodle dish, and learn the art of Thai cuisine as a local chef shares their unique techniques and recipes. Your culinary excursion will then take you to a Bangkok cooking school where you will test your knowledge gleaned at the markets and share a lunch of the local meals you prepare.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Head for the Northern Thai Hills
dayInfo.description: Chiang Mai is a fairly contemporary city set against the backdrop of Thailand’s jungle-clad mountains. Though it boasts modern amenities and lavish accommodation, it retains much of its old-world charm and the surrounding northern reaches remain rural, remote, and full of historic culture. After transferring to the northern Thai hills and settling into your accommodation in the heart of Chiang Mai, you may spend some time in the afternoon absorbing the local flair and flavor at spirited markets, golden temples, and Lanna precincts peppering the city.

dayInfo.title: Chiang Mai - Explore Lanna Heritage
dayInfo.description: Chiang Mai is a treasure trove of Thai culture you will discover with a knowledgeable guide after breakfast. The massive Warorot Market will invite you to tuck into authentic Lanna cuisine as you look out across the Ping River and the humming city backdrop. Your guide will then show you to significant temple complexes speckling the city and outskirts, including Wat Chiang Man, Wat Chedi Luang, Wat Suan Dok, and Wat Jet Yod. An afternoon drive up the mountain to Doi Suthep Temple will share remarkable panoramic views of northern Thailand and holy relics guarding the grounds.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Escape to Thai Shorelines
dayInfo.description: Your travels will take you to the sunbathed shores of Phuket. The large island offers plenty to see and do as you transfer from the airport to your accommodation overlooking the Andaman Sea. You will arrive, unpack, and wander to the beach where you will find a spot beneath the shady palm trees. Behind you, bartenders will flair and serve colorful cocktails as the sun begins to set. Towards the horizon, speed boats and jet skis will disappear behind the headlands as thrillseekers race around the island. The island will come to life as beach-lovers embrace the tropical lifestyle.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Jewels of the Andaman Sea
dayInfo.description: Phuket is a gateway to the jewels of the Andaman Sea, and you will join your guide and captain today for a cruise to see what lies beyond the shore. Snorkeling around Bamboo Island will reveal the marine life that swims below the water’s surface and hanging with the clever monkeys of Monkey Beach will present stunning wildlife photography. You will pass Viking Cave to learn about fascinating mysteries, discover the vibrant island of Koh Phi Phi, and capture postcard-perfect scenery as you arrive in the emerald waters of Pileh Lagoon.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Explore the Island at Leisure
dayInfo.description: Your final full day in Thailand is left unplanned for you to freely enjoy the pleasures of Phuket. You may try authentic delicacies at the thronging markets, sit back and enjoy the sunshine around your pool, sunbathe on the sparkling beaches, or partake in a vitalizing yoga routine led by enthusiastic locals. However you choose to spend your day in Phuket, you will feel your worries melt away as you relish the laidback Thai lifestyle that sweeps the tropical island paradise and enjoy a delicious seafood dinner during sunset.

dayInfo.title: Phuket - Explore Before You Go
dayInfo.description: Your vacation to the Maldives and Thailand will come to an end today, though you will relish the morning to take in as much as possible before you transfer to the international airport for your flight. You may join locals at busy markets and wander between the colorful food stalls sizzling as fried foods boil in piping hot oil, head to the beaches around the corner from your accommodation for a swim in the balmy sea, or explore Phuket Old Town to visit a few more museums and boutiques before you leave.

tourName: Perfect Maldives Vacation: Island Escapes and Pristine Beaches
placesVisited: Huvahendhoo Island, Ari Atoll, Dhonakulhi Island, Haa Alifu Atoll
generalInfo: Experience supreme luxury and delightful attention during your 11-day Maldives vacation. From clear azure waters to lush tropical forest, overwater bungalows to private island escapes, you can delight in the opulent spirit of secluded islands. As you embrace the perfect island retreat, you will bask in the serene ambiance or discover exciting excursions that bring your surroundings into a new light.

dayInfo.title: Huvahendhoo - Arrive on Idyllic Huvahendhoo Island
dayInfo.description: The Maldives is home to unrivaled luxury represented by white-sand beaches and pristine azure waters. Your flight will land in Male, the capital and most populous city in the archipelago. You will continue by seaplane to Huvahendhoo Island on what will feel like a scenic flight over the crystal-clear Indian Ocean for views of the distant coastlines of the scattered coral islands. Upon your arrival at the resort, you will have the remainder of the day at your leisure to indulge in the five-star luxuries of an overwater villa accentuated by a private butler and surrounding idyllic waters.

dayInfo.title: Huvahendhoo - Embrace Paradise at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you may find the aromas of breadfruit and papaws accompanying the subtle scent of the sea. The day will be at your leisure to experience and explore the atoll at your preferred pace. With seemingly endless options for things to do, you can begin your exploration of the waters on a glass-bottom canoe. Take to the water to feel the warm waters of the Indian Ocean as you paddle around the celebrated lagoon, easily spotting vibrant fish and colorful coral. You can plunge into the water for a closer look at long-nosed butterflyfish or imperial angelfish.

dayInfo.title: Huvahendhoo - Discover South Ari Atoll
dayInfo.description: With so many options to choose from, the day is yours to discover the island and South Ari Atoll. Delve deeper into luxury with a private escape to a hamacland, a floating platform anchored in the private lagoon. Relax on elevated hammocks as the gentle water soothes you by effortlessly rocking. Bask in the views and the private island big enough for two as you overlook the clear water and the distant island shore. You can jump into the water for a quick dip and dry off once more in the tropical sun.

dayInfo.title: Huvahendhoo - Enjoy your Idyllic Surroundings
dayInfo.description: For a different perspective of the Maldives, you can set away from Huvahendhoo for the day and visit Dhangethi island, known for the local history and vibrant culture. The island itself will welcome you with lush greenery and beaches carpeted with snow-white sands. Shops showcase artisan craftsmanship with the likes of wooden vases and books made with coconut timber. You can take to the water once more, but this time on a traditional dhoni boat.

dayInfo.title: Huvahendhoo - Delight in the Maldives’s Beauty
dayInfo.description: Dive deeper into the wonders of the sea after breakfast with a semi-submarine excursion. You can step into the hull to find exceptional and unique views of the marine life seen through the glass windows. See the paradise submerged in the crystal-clear waters as signs of stingrays and coral mounds come into view. The tranquil atmosphere will still leave you with a sense of excitement as you spend time both with your view from the boat and as you snorkel.

dayInfo.title: Dhonakulhi - Transfer to Dhonakulhi Island
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will travel from Huvahendhoo island to reach Dhonakulhi island, home to a pristine island retreat at the northern end of the Haa Alifu Atoll. Enjoy the private escape tucked into the mixture of tropical trees, azure waters, and white-sand beaches as you settle into the luxury of a stunning villa. The remainder of the day will be at your leisure to soak in the new ambiance. For an enticing and soothing immersion into the resort, you can revel in a spa treatment meant for bringing together a harmonious experience of body, mind, and environment.

dayInfo.title: Dhonakulhi - Indulge in Haa Alifu Atoll’s Charms
dayInfo.description: The scent of coconut may sweep through the resort alongside the aromas of the Indian Ocean after breakfast. The remainder of the day is yours to indulge in the beauty of your surroundings as you take advantage of the various experiences your resort will offer. You can spend the day on a deserted island to truly feel the depth of tropical paradise and adventure. You can feel far from civilization and within the depths of nature as you embrace the emerald leaves and find fish around the encircling reef until the aroma of a private barbecue lunch fills the air.

dayInfo.title: Dhonakulhi - Relax at your Leisure on Dhonakulhi
dayInfo.description: You can spend time lounging in a private pool, relaxing on the sands, or once more relaxing with a soothing massage. At the end of the day, partake in a unique excursion of night snorkeling. Several marine creatures glow with bioluminescence that can attract mates, as well as make it easier for you to spot them in the dark. The glint creates a fascinating spectacle in the water and adds an extra surreal layer to the wonders of the reef.

dayInfo.title: Dhonakulhi - Find your Pace on the Island Paradise
dayInfo.description: Today, you can focus on the cuisine if you wish to indulge in secluded dining experiences that only add to your enchanting time on the secluded island. An in-villa dining service will give you an unprecedented private meal while highlighting the exotic local flavors focused on the ocean, beach, and tropical trees. When you are ready, you can plunge back into the water with the sensational coral reef acting as your backyard. The fish shine rainbows of color, and you may even spot a turtle searching for a snack as the calm, warm water welcomes you.

dayInfo.title: Dhonakulhi - Bask in the Splendor of the Maldives
dayInfo.description: You can welcome the morning with a unique exploration of the water on a stand-up paddleboard or spend time stretching with an early yoga class overlooking the island. Your final day in the Maldives is once more at your leisure with plenty of excursions and activities to enjoy. For a more active day, you can take a tennis lesson on the property or enjoy a quieter outing with a fly fishing excursion that will take you to unexplored sand flats known for hosting giant trevally and groupers.

dayInfo.title: Dhonakulhi - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can enjoy a private breakfast and views over the water. Boats may fill the marina as they ferry visitors to and from the island or bring produce to the market. Before you depart for home, you can bask once more in the endless beauty of the resort and the surrounding island. When you are ready, you will head back to Male airport and check-in for your flight home bringing an end to your luxurious Maldives discovery from south to north.

tourName: Resplendent Retreat to Maldives Resort and Cruise for 8 Days
generalInfo: Resplendent private island resorts and lavish charter cruises take you on an exploration of unrivaled marine beauty on an 8-day Maldives sailing adventure across the archipelago. This tailored tour takes you to pearl-white beaches, sprawling sapphire seas, luminous coral reefs, and sun-soaked islands that draw travelers from all over the world to the tropical region. Snorkel, scuba dive, and soak up the splendors of the Maldives on this glamorous getaway.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Cottoncandy Sunsets
dayInfo.description: The Maldives is a glamorous getaway destination that boasts the world’s best beaches and lavish private island resorts to boot. Waves lap against the pearl-white sands, marine life thrives within coral sanctuaries off the coastlines, and culinary traditions invite visitors to explore the flavors of the archipelago. These are but a few of the pleasures to treasure during your stay on a coveted private island overlooking the shimmering sea. To acclimate to your home away from home, you may stroll across the silky shore or sip cocktails on your stylish terrace as sunset covers the sky in a playful combination of colors.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Magnificent Marine Moments
dayInfo.description: Waves rolling against the shore will soundtrack your first morning in the Maldives as you step out onto your terrace and catch a glimpse of Spinner dolphins leaping out from the cyan sea. Your days on the private island are intentionally unplanned, allowing you to go with the island-style flow at leisure and choose to explore at your pace. Today, you may partake in stunning seaside activities such as snorkeling or paddleboarding, take to the skies on a scenic flight over the archipelagic country, fish from private bungalows floating over the turquoise ocean, and tuck into fresh local seafood dishes.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Embrace the Island Lifestyle
dayInfo.description: You will wake up, tuck into breakfast, and spend your morning embracing the treasure trove of seaside experiences in the Maldives. From another round of snorkeling or swimming to relishing your resort’s luxury amenities, you will absorb the magic of the Maldives. There is nothing as soothing as a spa therapy overlooking the sea during sunset. Your masseuse will invite you to choose from a collection of sensational treatments as you enjoy a complimentary cocktail and then perform your chosen therapy as you watch the sun fade behind the horizon and transform the sky in golden, pink, and purple hues.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Set Sail for the Ari Atoll
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you will pack your things and transfer via speedboat to a port where you will climb on board a private charter cruise. Your captain will welcome you to your floating resort, and you will toast a complimentary cocktail as the ship sets sail for the Ari Atoll. Being one of the largest ring-shaped reefs in the Maldives archipelago, Ari Atoll boasts some of the best scuba diving and snorkeling spots in the world. Your tranquil voyage across the beautiful blue waters of the Indian Ocean will bring you to these surreal marine sanctuaries over the next few days.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Adventures at Madivaru Kandu
dayInfo.description: Your mornings on the private charter cruise share surreal sunrise views from every angle as you choose to indulge in breakfast from your intimate balcony, the glamorous dining hall, or the sun-kissed deck. Today, the vessel will head for the sandy channel of Madivaru Kandu. You should keep your eyes peeled for stingrays swirling across the sandy seafloor and eagle rays appearing to fly across the ocean. You will choose to snorkel or scuba dive the dreamy underwater paradise using professional equipment and safety gear. Swimming below the surface, you may spot reef sharks and schools of snappers and triggerfish.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Make Way for Maaya Thila
dayInfo.description: Your charter will sail for the protected marine reserve of Maaya Thila this morning as you savor breakfast. Arriving at the reef, you will look out for common grey reef sharks and the distinct white-tipped fins of the whitetip reef sharks that circle the coral in abundance. You could plunge into the depths of the coral overhang that drops down into the oceanic darkness or glide to the archaic caves that conceal dog-toothed tuna, great barracuda, and much more. Afterward, you will visit the local village on Maalhos island to immerse yourself in the Maldive’s culture and customs.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Nocturnal Marine Discoveries
dayInfo.description: Your final day exploring the breathtaking Maldives archipelago will bring you to the sparkling shores of Meeru Island, where you will enjoy the morning and afternoon lounging underneath palm trees, swimming in the crystal clear waters, and snorkeling colorful coral reefs beyond the coast. If the weather permits, you may partake in a night dive or night fishing experience illuminated by the stars and powerful torches positioned on the charter. These opportunities will let you catch a glimpse of the Maldive’s nocturnal marine creatures and the underwater world left unworried by the daylight activity across the archipelago.

dayInfo.title: Maldives - Snorkeling and Sightseeing
dayInfo.description: It will be your last morning in the Maldives and your last opportunity to snorkel the stunning coral reefs that circle the archipelago and its sunbathed island paradises. After submerging below the glassy sea to capture the underwater creatures with waterproof cameras, you will return to your room to pack your things and devour a sumptuous breakfast spread on board the charter. Arriving on the shore, you will transfer to the airport and begin your journey back home having made magnificent memories and marine discoveries during your time in the Maldives.

tourName: Romance in Sri Lanka & The Maldives for 14 Days
placesVisited: Thirappane, Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa, Sigiriya, Kandy, Hatton, Galle, Bentota, Colombo, Laamu Atoll
generalInfo: Boundless beauty is yours to discover on this resplendent 14-day tour of Sri Lanka and the Maldives that will take you to a collection of palatial resorts set within some of the world’s most breathtaking settings. Along the way, your expedition will reveal the spiritual origins of local culture, present bucolic scenes in which you can indulge, and share moments worth swooning over on exclusive island getaways.

dayInfo.title: Thirappane - Splendors of the Sri Lankan Countryside
dayInfo.description: You will be met by your private transfer at Colombo International Airport and transfer to an exquisite resort located approximately 5 hours away in the sprawling unspoiled wilderness of Thirappane. Your journey will be comfortable and serene, spotlighting the unending natural beauty that veils the Sri Lankan countryside. Upon arrival, your palatial accommodation will boast lush landscape vistas of the tranquil Ulagalla Lake and suites embellished in historical furnishings yet bejeweled with unrivaled modern amenities indicative of a top-tier secluded resort. You may lap up moments lounging around the pool or galloping across the resort on horseback before turning in.

dayInfo.title: Thirappane - Astonishing Ancient Stories Shrouding Anuradhapura
dayInfo.description: Poised on the rolling hills surrounding Sri Lanka’s ancient capital Anuradhapura, you will have swift access to the fascinating history that emanates from this age-old city from your accommodation. Chaperoned by an insightful tour guide, you will begin your journey through time visiting the Sri Maha Bodhi. The Sacred Bo-Tree is hallowed as the oldest historically documented tree and the very place where Prince Siddhartha achieved enlightenment. This history is rarely eclipsed but more Sri Lankan fables will come to life as you appreciate the ornate stone carvings of the Brazen Palace and climb the colossal granite slabs of Mihintale.

dayInfo.title: Sigiriya - Peer into the History of Polonnaruwa
dayInfo.description: After a sumptuous breakfast, join your private tour guide and escape to the century-old Sri Lankan second capital and UNESCO World Heritage Site of Polonnaruwa. Within the venerated city grounds, you will find moments of magic admiring the remarkable Gal Viharaya Buddhist monuments, treasured Royal Palace ruins, and cherished Shiva Temple complex. With each passing minute, you will delve ever deeper into Sri Lanka’s spiritual and societal origins further presented by the 5th Century Sigiriya rock fortress, a fresco-emblazoned citadel where you will find refuge nearby in a spectacular secluded forest resort of the grandest design.

dayInfo.title: Kandy - Dreamy Discoveries within the Dambulla Caves
dayInfo.description: You will be chauffeured from Sigiriya to Kandy this morning after your resplendent breakfast. Beyond gazing over breathtaking sceneries pouring across the countryside towards the horizon, you will be besotted by the phenomenal Dambulla cave temples etched into a cliffside. Five sacred caves plastered in ornate works of art compose the enriching environment on which you will walk, sharing images to swoon over and capture in all their sanctified glory. Before arriving in Kandy afterward, you will enjoy an indulgent tour of a Matale spice garden where you will taste a collection of spice-infused delicacies distinct to the local cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Kandy - Serenity within Sri Lanka’s Spellbinding Environments
dayInfo.description: Kandy is a charming Sri Lankan city stationed on a prolific plateau circled by soaring summits. Its beauty oozes from these natural surroundings, but also the boundless peaceful experiences on offer. Your day will be dedicated to reflection and appreciation of the local spiritual lifestyle and its evocative environments. An uplifting guided meditation within the Samadhi Center will lay the foundations for a vitalizing retreat within Kandy, continuing within the Peradeniya Botanical Gardens. Led by a professional Botanist, you will adore weaving through astounding orchid gardens to fragrant flower fields and bountiful fruit plantations bathing in the sun’s golden radiance.

dayInfo.title: Hatton - High Tea on Hatton’s Picturesque Plantations
dayInfo.description: Desolate and dripping in natural wonders, Hatton is a picture-perfect getaway destination flung far off the beaten path. A spectacular scenic train trip showing off Sri Lanka’s ceaseless countryside charm will bring you to a flourishing tea plantation set amidst the staggering emerald environment. Here, colonial-era bungalows have been repurposed into exquisite private suites featuring personal chefs, butlers, and high tea every afternoon. Whether you choose to rest and unwind to spectacles of the surreal wildlife scenes or exercise your adventurous spirit on a leisurely pilgrimage across the shaded jungle paths, tranquility will seduce you from the moment you arrive.

dayInfo.title: Hatton - Immersed in the History of Hatton’s Hallowed Tea
dayInfo.description: Regarded by many as the source of the world’s best teas, Sri Lanka’s Hatton plantations are yours to explore to your heart's content as you visit a local plantation and discover the mastered art of tea making in the region. From planting to “plucking”, lose yourselves in the creative process and treat yourselves to the mouthwatering blends of the region’s finest Ceylon brews. With a steamy cup in hand, allow your senses to be overwhelmed by the fragrant aromas and distinct flavors of these exceptionally well-produced blends that will forever hold a place in the hearts of the Hatton locals.

dayInfo.title: Galle - Modern Luxuries in a Postcard-Perfect Colonial Port City
dayInfo.description: Sri Lanka’s environmental splendors spread from the countryside to its sun-soaked coastlines, where you will discover the old-world port city of Galle. Dutch Colonial and Portuguese architecture dominate the classical settlement, spotlighting a dramatic history within its antique buildings and dated monuments. Your base will be a contemporary seaside resort equipped with state-of-the-art amenities and styled in tasteful minimalist touches, a spellbinding contrast to the historic discoveries that await outside your isolated suite. You may spend these moments strolling through Galle to trace back the history that shrouds the old city or unwinding with a rejuvenating spa therapy.

dayInfo.title: Galle - Touring the Teas of Galle by Tuk-Tuk
dayInfo.description: Galle is Sri Lanka’s answer to a tropical paradise, boasting surreal seaside scenes of a turquoise ocean teeming with colorful marine life and gorgeous beaches to spend the day slowly soaking up the balmy rays and wallowing in the crystal water. After a morning enjoyed at your own pace, you will visit a nearby tea factory by tuk-tuk , a traditional three-wheeled open-air vehicle. You will zigzag past traffic and along alleys inaccessible to cars on a journey as authentic as it gets before arriving at the factory where you will pair an exquisite local meal with exceptional fresh brews.

dayInfo.title: Colombo - Absorbed by the Masterwork of Geoffrey Bawa
dayInfo.description: Bentota is a blissful beach resort town brimming with mesmerizing scenic highlights that will dazzle you during your brief stop at famous Sri Lankan architect Geoffrey Bawa’s hypnotizing home. Here, you will treat yourselves to a resplendent lunch served in the manicured gardens fringing the astonishing work of architecture, an absorbing afternoon you will remember as clear as day. Afterward, you will continue to Sri Lanka’s bustling commercial capital Colombo where you will relish your evening enjoying the emblematic energy reverberating through its buzzing and vivacious streets laden with colorful markets.

dayInfo.title: Laamu Atoll - An Island for Only a Few and You
dayInfo.description: Today, you will transfer from Colombo to a grandiose beach resort poised on the picture-perfect Laamu Atoll island in the Maldives. The only accommodation blessed to be a part of this spectacular island paradise, this is as secluded and splendid as it gets. From the moment you arrive after two brief plane trips, the latter from Male to Laamu included, you will be swept away by the sheer unspoiled seascape sweeping the island’s velvety pearl-white shoreline. From your balcony, you will capture images of dolphins leaping from the crystal clear water and emerald forests spiraling across the headlands behind you.

dayInfo.title: Laamu Atoll - Stellar Sea Sightings and Luxuriant Forested Landscapes
dayInfo.description: Off the serene coast of Laamu Atoll, a world of marine wonders lay beneath the glistening water’s surface for you to discover snorkeling over the vibrant coral reefs. Today, you may live in the lap of luxury as you exclusively explore the underwater world teeming with fascinating sea life encounters from dazzling luminous parrotfish to gentle giant green turtles. If you wish to see what lies within the luxuriant forests flanking the beachfront, then you may wander along the greenery-fringed pathways which weave through the jungle to views reminiscent of those stumbled upon in glossy magazines.

dayInfo.title: Laamu Atoll - Over the Swells to a Desert Island by Dhoni
dayInfo.description: From aromatherapeutic spa remedies offered by your world-class therapy center to indulgent cuisine served on the stylish restaurant terrace, you may spend your morning reveling in the grand experiences of Laamu Atoll. In the afternoon, you may board a traditional wooden Dhoni boat for an excursion over the gentle swells to a castaway desert island rarely stepped foot on. Here, you may dive into the depths of the azure sea to witness the marvels below or simply soak up the scenes from the glittery beach as you tuck into privately prepared haute cuisine.

dayInfo.title: Laamu Atoll - Memorable Moments in Sri Lanka and the Maldives
dayInfo.description: Savor the distinct flavors of the Maldives one last time in the most resplendent fashion as you devour a private buffet overlooking the sprawling seascape before you take delight in a brief included flight back to Male where you will transfer onto your plane bound for home. You will soon take to the skies leaving the mesmerizing Maldives behind, but taking with you thousands of unforgettable memories of your bewitching moments spent relishing regality from Sri Lanka to the Maldives.
